title: Cristín Cibils
text:
Cristín Eugenio Cibils González (born 13 March 1956 in <a href="Loma%20Pyt%C3%A1">Loma Pytá</a>, <a href="Paraguay">Paraguay</a>) is a former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender.
Career.
Cibils started his career at the youth divisions of <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Juventud%20%28Loma%20Pyt%C3%A1%29">Atlético Juventud</a> of his hometown Loma Pytá. He then moved to <a href="Olimpia%20Asunci%C3%B3n">Olimpia</a> where he spent several years in the reserve and as usually came in as a substitute. Cibils was then transferred to <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tembetary">Tembetary</a> where he spent his best years as he was called up to the <a href="Paraguay%20national%20football%20team">Paraguay national football team</a> and was part of the squad that won the <a href="Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica%201979">Copa América 1979</a>. In 1980, he had a brief spell with <a href="Cerro%20Porte%C3%B1o">Cerro Porteño</a> where the club finished in second place in the Paraguayan league. After a few years in <a href="Club%20Guaran%C3%AD">Guaraní</a> he was loaned to <a href="Club%20de%20Deportes%20La%20Serena">La Serena</a> of <a href="Chile">Chile</a>. In 1985, he returned to Olimpia, but his position was well covered by players such as <a href="Rogelio%20Delgado">Rogelio Delgado</a> and <a href="Gustavo%20Ben%C3%ADtez%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201953%29">Gustavo Benítez</a> so Cibils had very limited playing time which made him leave the club to <a href="Club%20Boquer%C3%B3n">Boquerón</a> and <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Juventud%20%28Loma%20Pyt%C3%A1%29">Atlético Juventud</a> where he finished his career in 1989.
